messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: Umetada Habaki
messages.msgSnippet: Rich and Milt, I haven t seen a signed example.  Here s a drawing from Kajihara s Visual Glossary: http://tinyurl.com/kfnv The rough lines show the direction
messages.messageBody:
Rich and Milt,
I haven't seen a signed example. Here's a drawing from Kajihara's Visual Glossary:

http://tinyurl.com/kfnv

The rough lines show the direction of the very fine file marks in the gold. It's a multi piece construction. The flat, wide base plate is probably the most obvious diagnostic feature, but once you've seen a few the type stands out. I probably have a photo of an actual example somewhere, but this will have to do for now. If anyone has a photo please post it or send it to me for posting.

The style and quality of file work is also seen in solid gold Umetada tsuba.

Jim



Jim -

What is distinctive about Umetada habaki? I wouldn't know one
if I tripped over it. Any pics avaiable?

Thanks
Rich S


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
